nodes.name: miscommunication from ambiguous terminology in interpersonal discourse
aliases: language misunderstanding due to vague words
nodes.description: Breakdowns in mutual understanding arising when conversation participants use words that carry multiple, contested or idiosyncratic meanings.
nodes.node_rationale: Opening paragraph highlights the core risk that unclear language impedes communication (Communicating Clearly – introduction).

nodes.name: alternate meaning attribution to common terms in discourse
nodes.description: Individuals assign special importance or private meanings to widely-used words, which generates divergent interpretations across speakers.
nodes.node_rationale: Essay notes conspiracy theorists ‘attribute special importance or personal/alternate meanings to commonly used words’ (same section).

nodes.name: using precise uncontested terminology reduces interpretive variance in discourse
nodes.description: Selecting words with stable, narrow meanings minimises the scope for divergent interpretation among recipients.
nodes.node_rationale: Author asserts that avoiding highly contested words makes intended meaning clearer (bullet list item 1).

nodes.name: systematic avoidance of ambiguous contested words in discourse
nodes.description: Communication strategy that proactively filters out words known to be polysemous, politically charged or philosophically disputed.
nodes.node_rationale: Bullet list presents deliberate steps to sidestep words like ‘consciousness’ or ‘free will’. This is the explicit solution approach.

nodes.name: replacing ambiguous terms with specific alternatives during communication
nodes.description: Operational mechanism whereby ambiguous words are automatically or manually substituted by more specific, well-defined expressions in real time.
nodes.node_rationale: Implementation detail implied by ‘use a word that more unambiguously means what you intend to convey’ (bullet list item 1).

nodes.name: observation of conspiracy theorists misusing common words leading to misunderstanding
nodes.description: Author’s anecdotal observation that conspiracy theorists often exploit ambiguous terms, illustrating miscommunication consequences.
nodes.node_rationale: Provides qualitative evidence grounding the problem and motivating the proposed solution (introduction).

nodes.name: implement text rewriting tools that replace ambiguous terms with precise definitions before model response deployment
nodes.description: Develop or integrate a preprocessing module in conversational AI systems that scans user prompts and model outputs, substitutes highly contested words with clearer alternatives or appends explicit definitions, thereby reducing miscommunication risk.
nodes.intervention_lifecycle_rationale: Operates at deployment time, modifying outgoing text prior to user delivery (implicit from deployment-oriented goal of clearer communication).
nodes.intervention_maturity_rationale: Only an inferred, proof-of-concept idea extrapolated from author’s recommendations; no systematic validation reported (entire essay).
nodes.node_rationale: Translates author’s human-communication advice into an actionable AI safety intervention to minimise ambiguity-related misunderstandings.
